content:
{{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-332-02-A |Item_parent=Shock. Main aetiologies: hypovolaemic, septic (see item 158), cardiogenic, anaphylactic. |Item_parent_short=Shock. Main aetiologies: hypovolaemic, septic (see item 158), cardiogenic, anaphylactic. |Rank=A |Title=Know the main causes of shock |Description=Cardiogenic, obstructive, septic, haemorrhagic and anaphylactic shock. |Rubric=Etiologies |Contributors=Julien Poissy |Order=2}} We distinguish 4 nosological frameworks according to the haemodynamic profile, linked to a variable physiopathology:
{| class="wikitable" |Type of shock |Cardiogenic : heart pump failure |Hypovolemic : decrease in intravascular volume |Distributive : Circulatory, inflammatory and metabolic failure |Obstructive : Circulatory obstruction |- |Main etiologies | -Profuse diarrhoea/vomiting |. -Anaphylactic shock |

question.question: What is the main cause of cardiogenic shock?
question.option_c: Heart failure on chronic heart disease: hypertensive, dilated
